title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 200.7 - Authorization to administer oaths
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 200.7 - Authorization to administer oaths

State Regulations
(a) All court clerks employed in court
parts devoted in whole or in part to the disposition of criminal actions, and
such other employees as the judge presiding therein may designate in accordance
with section
105
of the Uniform District Court Act, section
105
of
the Uniform City Court Act, section
109
of the Uniform Justice Court Act and section
23
(1)
of the New York City Criminal Court Act, are authorized to administer oaths, take acknowledgments and sign the process
of the court under the seal thereof. (b) Copies of written authorizations to
administer oaths required by section
58
of the New York City Criminal Court Act to
be filed with the New York City Criminal Court are to be filed with the chief
clerk thereof. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
200.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
